title: How to Swipe Between Apps on a Mac

steps.title: Click System Preferences.
steps.content: Click System Preferences . Click Show All at the top of the window if you don't see the main System Preferences options.

steps.title: Click the Trackpad or Mouse option.
steps.content: Click the Trackpad or Mouse option. Choose Trackpad if you're using a MacBook or a Magic Trackpad. Click Mouse if you're using a Magic Mouse.

steps.title: Check the Swipe between full-screen apps box.
steps.content: Check the Swipe between full-screen apps box. The number of fingers the gesture uses will be displayed below.

steps.title: Click the menu underneath.
steps.content: Click the menu underneath. If you're using a trackpad, you can change the number of fingers the gesture uses.

steps.title: Click the number of fingers you want to use.
steps.content: Click the number of fingers you want to use. You can switch between three fingers or four fingers for the gesture. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Place four fingers on your trackpad or two on your magic mouse.
steps.content: Place four fingers on your trackpad or two on your magic mouse. If you set your trackpad to use the three finger gesture instead, just use three fingers.

steps.title: Open some apps in full-screen view.
steps.content: Open some apps in full-screen view. This gesture only works if you have two or more apps open in full-screen view. You can switch apps to full-screen view from their View menus or by pressing Ctrl + âŒ˜ Command + F .

steps.title: Swipe left and right to switch between your full screen apps.
steps.content: Swipe left and right to switch between your full screen apps. Swipe all of your fingers at once to switch between your open full-screen apps.
